item.description:
This hike is going to be led by Diana (imanaturegirl@yahoo.com) and Dwight (dphette@metrocast.net) who kindly stepped up after I had to bow out due to a work-related conflict.

Dwight has done hiking in Bear Brook before and knows the trails!  Diana is just getting back into it and will bring up the rear!

Please contact Dwight with any questions about meeting place and weather!  Also, please update your RSVP as it gets closer to the date!

I will send Dwight and Diana an up-dated list of people going the day before!

THANKS!

 

Loop hike in Bear Brook State Park, Allenstown, NH. Depending on the weather and the temperatures, it could be as short as 2.5 miles RT, or we could do a longer loop, going +/- 5 miles. Rolling terrain, some climbing, elevation gain of 450 feet. Nice views and will be a pretty hike if there is snow!

This is for people who are just getting into it, getting BACK into it or just want a less-strenuous hike! I have taken the AMC Beginning Winter Hiking course and want to hike with some of my newer gear and see how things go in colder conditions. Even though this is a short hike, please be prepared for cold weather!

This should be a great hike for snowshoes...but even if there isn't too much snow, you will want some kind of traction (like microspikes!) I am a very slow hiker, so if you're just starting out, please don't be worried about keeping up! I just plod along, one foot in front of the other!

Wear layers, gloves or mittens, insulated boots, a hat and bring snacks, extra socks and at least 2 liters of water. No cotton! Dog friendly, kids welcome.

Description of the hike and a trail map here:
http://www.hikeneweng...

Read about the park here:
http://www.nhstatepar...


Driving Directions
The parking area for this hike is located in Bear Brook State Park in Allenstown, New Hampshire.

From Rt. 4:
* From the Epsom Traffic Circle, take Rt. 28 South.
* Travel on Rt. 28 South for 5.6 miles.
* Turn left onto Bear Brook Road which runs through the state park and is marked by a large sign. This road is also knows as Allenstown-Deerfield Road or State Park Road.
* After about a mile you will reach the park's tollbooth on the right.
* Park in the large parking lot on the left immediately past the tollbooth.


From Rt. 3:
* From the junction of Routes 3 and 28 in Suncook, take Rt. 28 North.
* Travel on Rt. 28 North for 3.0 miles.
* Turn right onto Bear Brook Road which runs through the state park and is marked by a large sign. This road is also knows as Allenstown-Deerfield Road or State Park Road.
* After about a mile you will reach the park's tollbooth on the right.
* Park in the large parking lot on the left immediately past the tollbooth.
